alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 12:21PM EDT until July 09 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Adams, Cumberland and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1220 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Additional torrential rainfall may lead to more serious flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Shippensburg, Greencastle, Guilford, Fayetteville, Wayne Heights, Mont Alto, Newville, Rouzerville, Marion, Walnut Bottom, State Line, Quincy, Penn State Mont Alto and Shippensburg University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
